unnormalised: Okay, so I wanted to share my experience with finding a good gynaecologist in Mumbai. It's been a journey, let me tell you! Especially after moving from Delhi last year.
normalised: Okay, so I wanted to share my experience with finding a good gynaecologist in Mumbai. It's been a journey, let me tell you! Especially after moving from Delhi last year.

unnormalised: First off, figuring out who to trust with your, you know, *bits*, is kinda daunting. My first OBGYN was Dr. Sharma at Breach Candy hospital. Seemed nice enough at first, prescribed me Vit D 60k IU, but honestly, the appointments felt rushed. Like, 5 mins and she was gone.
normalised: First off, figuring out who to trust with your, you know, bits, is kind of daunting. My first O-B-G-Y-N was Doctor Sharma at Breach Candy hospital. Seemed nice enough at first, prescribed me Vitamin D sixty thousand I-U, but honestly, the appointments felt rushed. Like, five minutes and she was gone.

unnormalised: Then, a friend recommended Dr. Patel at Lilavati. He was definitely more patient. Explained everything in detail, from my Pap smear results to what exactly PCOS means. Still, something felt off. Maybe it was the waiting time – sometimes over 2 hrs! Imagine being preggers and waiting that long!
normalised: Then, a friend recommended Doctor Patel at Lilavati. He was definitely more patient. Explained everything in detail, from my Pap smear results to what exactly P-C-O-S means. Still, something felt off. Maybe it was the waiting time – sometimes over two hours! Imagine being preggers and waiting that long!

unnormalised: So, I started doing some serious research online. Joined a few Mumbai mom groups on FB. Read a bunch of articles. Even checked out Practo reviews (you know, the ones that seem legit, not the super fake ones lol).
normalised: So, I started doing some serious research online. Joined a few Mumbai mom groups on F-B. Read a bunch of articles. Even checked out Practo reviews (you know, the ones that seem legit, not the super fake ones laugh out loud).

unnormalised: That's how I found Dr. Kapoor at Fortis. She's a total gem. She specializes in high-risk pregnancies, which isn’t something I need *yet* (fingers crossed!), but she’s also super thorough with routine check-ups. My HbA1c was a little high, like 6.1%, so she suggested some dietary changes.
normalised: That's how I found Doctor Kapoor at Fortis. She's a total gem. She specializes in high-risk pregnancies, which isn’t something I need yet (fingers crossed!), but she’s also super thorough with routine check-ups. My H-b-A-one-c was a little high, like six point one percent, so she suggested some dietary changes.

unnormalised: She even showed me the ultrasound images and explained what everything meant. She's also very open to different birthing options. Like, she discussed C-sections vs. normal delivery without any judgement. She also mentioned about prenatal yoga and other stuff.
normalised: She even showed me the ultrasound images and explained what everything meant. She's also very open to different birthing options. Like, she discussed C-sections versus normal delivery without any judgement. She also mentioned about prenatal yoga and other stuff.

unnormalised: And get this, she actually *listens*! Remember how Dr. Sharma only spent 5 mins with me? Dr. Kapoor spends like, 30 mins easy. She answers all my silly questions (even the ones I’m too embarrassed to ask anyone else, haha). And her clinic is clean, and the staff is super friendly.
normalised: And get this, she actually listens! Remember how Doctor Sharma only spent five minutes with me? Doctor Kapoor spends like, thirty minutes easy. She answers all my silly questions (even the ones I’m too embarrassed to ask anyone else, ha ha). And her clinic is clean, and the staff is super friendly.

unnormalised: The cost is also something to consider. Dr. Sharma's consultation was around Rs. 2000, while Dr. Kapoor's is Rs. 3000. But honestly, for the peace of mind and the level of care, it's totally worth it, right? Plus, she accepts my insurance, which is a huge bonus.
normalised: The cost is also something to consider. Doctor Sharma's consultation was around rupees two thousand, while Doctor Kapoor's is rupees three thousand. But honestly, for the peace of mind and the level of care, it's totally worth it, right? Plus, she accepts my insurance, which is a huge bonus.

unnormalised: Honestly, finding a good gynaecologist is like finding the perfect chai stall. It takes time, effort, and a whole lot of trial and error. But when you find the right one, it makes all the difference.
normalised: Honestly, finding a good gynaecologist is like finding the perfect chai stall. It takes time, effort, and a whole lot of trial and error. But when you find the right one, it makes all the difference.

unnormalised: So, yeah, that's my saga! Hope it helps any other Mumbai girls out there looking for a good OBGYN. Don't be afraid to shop around, ask questions, and trust your gut! You deserve the best possible care, especially when it comes to your reproductive health. Remember to check for their MMC number too, just to be sure.
normalised: So, yeah, that's my saga! Hope it helps any other Mumbai girls out there looking for a good O-B-G-Y-N. Don't be afraid to shop around, ask questions, and trust your gut! You deserve the best possible care, especially when it comes to your reproductive health. Remember to check for their M-M-C number too, just to be sure.
